1.q_string: Which of the following undergoes nucleophilic substitution exclusively by \(S_{N}1\) mechanism?

(1) \(CH _{3} CO _{2}^{-}\)

(2) \(H _{2} O\) 

(3) \(CH _{3} SO _{3}{ }^{-}\)

(4) \(- OH\)
The most reactive towards \(S N_{1}\) is:
The IUPAC name of the given structure is:
Which of the following compounds is an allyl bromide?

Consider the reaction, \(CH _{3} CH _{2} CH _{2} Br + NaCN \rightarrow CH _{3} CH _{2} CH _{2} CN + NaBr\).

This reaction will be the fastest in:

q_option: alkyl halide in the presence of alcohol
alkyl halide in the presence of phenol
alkyl halide in the presence of dry ether
alkyl halide in the presence of alcoholated ether

1.q_string: Which of the following is correct?

q_option: The rate of reaction is independent of the concentration of the nucleophile.

1.q_string:
Assertion:

In a coordination entity \(\left[ PtCl _{2}( en )_{2}\right]^{2+}\) omly the cis- isomer shows optical activity.

Reason:

Optical isomerism is common in octahedral complexes involving didentate ligands.

1.q_string: In \(S _{ N } 2\) reactions, the correct order of reactivity for the following compounds \(CH Cl _{3} CH _{3} CH _{2} Cl\), \(\left( CH _{3}\right)_{2} CHCl\) and \(\left( CH _{3}\right)_{3} CCl\) is:

i. \(\left( CH _{3}\right)_{2} CHCH _{2} CH _{2} Cl\)

ii. \(\left( CH _{3}\right)_{2} CHCH ( Cl ) CH _{3}\)

iii. \(\left( CH _{3}\right)_{2} C ( Cl ) CH _{2} CH _{3}\)

iv. \(CH _{3} CHCH _{2}\left( Cl)CH _{2} CH _{3}\right.\)

q_option: The magnitude of Van der Waal forces

they are stable compounds and are not reactive.
